content.content: Greetings from the Content Production Core Unit!  tl;dr  KPIs and OKRs The situation with our offboarding proposal has clearly gotten out of hand. The Content team has established OKRs and KPIs. Yes, it’s taken time to build the team and get operations in place so we can work toward them more actively but none of the individuals that have referenced our lack of OKRs/KPIs in the onboarding posts have bothered to reach out to myself or the team to see if they exist, nevermind discuss them or do the diligence to find it themselves and that clearly speaks to their intentions. While the team has privately discussed OKRs and KPIs somewhat regularly, a couple of factors have prevented us from reaching the point where we feel like we can focus on them in regular updates:   The lack of clarity around the Maker Foundation’s dissolution, shifting expectations about how and whether or not Core Units are supposed to work together, and ongoing lack of clarity regarding our budget has impacted our ability to grow and operationalize.   Our ability to measure KPIs is dependent on the KPIs of other teams and the DAO doesn’t have a holistic framework for measuring KPIs at this time.   When we do our jobs well, we give people reasons to see value in MakerDAO and help them get the information they need to make decisions that better serve the DAO. In theory, that should translate into growth in areas like governance participation, opportunities for business development, and vault usage, but we can’t meaningfully evaluate the performance of our content without a holistic view of KPIs it’s not our place to take responsibility for. We’ve made it clear we’re happy to collaborate on a solution but as @twblack88 alluded to in this post, we’re not in this alone and shouldn’t be expected to solve the DAO’s problems ourselves. @Recognized-Delegates  Explainer Videos Over the past month, our “How to Vote” video, currently published in the Voting Portal and on Vimeo, has received:  566 Views 331 Unique Views Top 5 Regions: US, Netherlands, Argentina, Germany, Canada 480 Views from vote.makerdao.com   We’re in the process of getting feedback on scripts and finishing animations on:  Gov Processes 1: Signal Requests and MIPs Gov Processes 2: Governance Polls & Executive Votes Liquidations   ETHDenver Video Content - Pre Production Progress The following content is planned for capture: Promotional video highlighting MakerDAO’s presence at ETHDenver, including showcasing Growth and Content Production’s respective events, sit-down interviews with the MakerDAO community and team members to be used for short documentaries and social media cutdowns, and hopefully interviews with members of other projects who work with Maker. Also, we will be gathering photographs across the event for social media.  Crew booked (DP, AC/2nd Cam, and potentially grip/gaffer to be added) Transportation booked Logistics planned Some members of the community have already privately committed to being interviewed Continuing to aggregate list of community members planning to attend Off-site venue for filming sit-down interviews located and quoted Camera packages selected, equipment list created, vendor quotes received, ready to order Question lists, shot lists, shooting schedules completed Production meeting with the Cinematographer scheduled for 01/17   Ambassador Program (Pilot) The Ambassador Program has gotten off to a roaring start, largely thanks to @Kat and @sebix. The team has already provided Spanish subtitles for the “How to Vote” explainer video and in addition to translating weekly polls, the Weekly Relay, State of Dai, and Multi-chain Dai-lights, the team is preparing Spanish translations of our MIPs and GovAlpha’s Operational Manual.  Translations  Multi-chain DAI-lights - 6 de Enero de 2022 Relay Semanal: 4 - 10 de Enero de 2022 Relay Semanal: 14 de diciembre de 2021 - 3 de enero de 2022 ¿Cómo Votar en el Protocolo de Maker? [Video ~ Subs. en español] MIP0: The Maker Improvement Proposal Framework  MIP4: MIP Amendment and Removal Process  MIP16: The Weekly Governance Cycle  MOM: Maker Improvement Proposals  MOM: Status & Dashboards  How to Vote (Video Subtitles)      Content Production In addition to the efforts described above, here are links to much of our work: Video   Published  [Maker Relay] The State of Dai (12/27/2021 - 1/3/2022) & (1/4/2022-1/10/2022)    Posted  MakerDAO | Forum At a Glance | January 06, 2022 Governance and Risk | Ep. 174 MakerDAO | 2021 Recap Governance and Risk | Ep. 173 MakerDAO | Forum At a Glance | December 16, 2021    Writing Want to read Maker Relay and Dai on Different Networks in your email? Sign up on Substack: https://makerdaoupdates.substack.com/.   Forum  Weekly Relay: Dec 14, 2021 - Jan 3, 2022 and Weekly Relay: January 4 - 10, 2022 in collaboration with GovComms. Multi-chain Dai-lights (January 6, 2022) & (January 13, 2022)  Maker Governance Review: 2021 in collaboration with GovComms    Substack  Maker Relay Ep 76 and Ep 77  The State of Dai Ep 18 and Ep 19     Graphics   @Kat created title cards for the Weekly Relay and State of Dai, which have now been split from Maker Relay.  Audio  ETH Denver Welcome Party (A Taste of Denver)  Venue Booked Artists Booked Food Planned Promo Designs complete Met with venue owners to discuss accepting crypto; this conversation is ongoing Announcements coming soon!     Transparency  Content Production Update - End-of-Year Review Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: 11/12 - 11/25 ETHDenver 2022 Planning Update Content Production Bi-Weekly Update:10/15 - 10/28 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: 9/16 - 9/29 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: Update 9/2 - 9/15 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: 8/19 - 9/1 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: 8/5 - 8/18 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: July 22 to August 4, 2021 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: July 8 - July 21, 2021 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: June 25 - July 7, 2021 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: May 27 - June 9, 2021 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: May 13 - May 26, 2021 Content Production Bi-Weekly Update: April 29 - May 12, 2021  As always, please join us for our weekly Office Hours on Wednesdays at 16:30 UTC.
Awesome  the Ambassador Program is a great idea
